On this National Public Safety Telecommunicators Week, I am grateful to Alabama's telecommunicators, who are always ready to answer a call for help. In fact, the first 9-1-1 call was made in Haleyville, Alabama, on February 16, 1968. This started the 9-1-1 emergency dispatch system, which is currently used nationwide to report crises and request police, fire, and medical assistance!

This week, the House passed the Working Dog Commemorative Coin Act. I introduced this legislation to honor the working dogs who protect Americans at home and abroad and the extraordinary people who benefit from their service. This bill directs the U.S. Treasury to mint and issue coins in commemoration of the service that these dogs provide to society. All sales of coins shall include a surcharge, which shall be paid to America's VetDogs for general expenses associated with the fulfillment of its mission.
